p: Different kinds of sausages including cooked sausage, fermented sausage, and fresh sausage are produced and consumed all over the world. Using chemical additives and preservatives are usually avoided in fresh sausages. This type of sausage is highly perishable and has short shelf life. The short shelf life can be due to the high pH value (pH > 5.5) and water holding capacity (aw > 0.97) (Carballo et al., 2019; Cocolin et al., 2004). Balkan‐style fresh sausage is based on a simple mixture of beef and lamb meat, salt, pepper, garlic, water, and bicarbonate sodium, stuffed in natural casings (Carballo et al., 2019).
